page.title: 03Kippax Church
page.content: Kippax church stands high on a vantage point over looking the area. There is evidence of habitation in the immediate locality of the church going as far back as the iron age. In 1948 a neolithic hammer head was discovered in the Westfield area of Allerton Bywater and in 1976 aerial photographs revealed an iron age sight approximately one mile easy of the present church. There is little evidence of Saxon dwellings apart from the broken remains of a carved cross shaft which can now be seen in the vestry. There are refrances in the Domesday book to ilbert de laceys land having 3 churches and 3 priests. The 3 churches being Kippax, Ledston + Barwick.
